definition:
Let ${\mathfrak{g}}$ be a finite dimensional Lie algebra over a field
$k$, and $X,Y\in{\mathfrak{g}}$. Let
${\mathrm{ad}}_X:{\mathfrak{g}}\to{\mathfrak{g}}$ be the adjoint action,
${\mathrm{ad}}_XY=[X,Y]$.

Then the Killing form on ${\mathfrak{g}}$ is a bilinear map
$$B_{{\mathfrak{g}}}:{\mathfrak{g}}\times{\mathfrak{g}}\to k$$ given by
$$B_{{\mathfrak{g}}}(X,Y)={\mathrm{tr}}({\mathrm{ad}}_X\circ{\mathrm{ad}}_Y).$$

The Killing form is under the adjoint action and symmetric (since trace
is symmetric).
